search_results.title: Zain Khalid - National Book Foundation
search_results.snippet: Zain Khalid is an American writer and novelist from New York. His debut novel, Brother Alive, won the New York Public Library's Young Lions Fiction Award.

search_results.title: Zain Khalid
search_results.snippet: Zain Khalid, named a “5 Under 35” honoree by the National Book Foundation in 2024, is the author of the debut novel, Brother Alive.

search_results.title: Zain Abdullah
search_results.snippet: Zain Abdullah teaches religion and society and Islamic studies at Temple University, and he is the author of Black Mecca: The African Muslims of Harlem.
